title: Fourth Annual Pride at the High Line: A United Front
description: The High Line at 17th Street (Meatpacking District).
address: The High Line at 17th Street (Meatpacking District)

title: Pride Celebration Dance Party at Riverside Park
Stud Country Line Dancing and Two-Stepping Party
Pride Panel: Queer Book Debuts You Should Know About
Pride on the Plaza Silent Disco
cost: Free (a credit or debit card is required for the check-in process to use the required headphones)

title: Kweendom: A Night of Queer Stand-Up
description: NYPL Stephen A. Schwarzman Building’s Celeste Auditorium (Midtown).
address: NYPL Stephen A. Schwarzman Building’s Celeste Auditorium (Midtown)

title: Queer Window LGBTQIA+ Sketch Show: Pride Edition
Moleskine Sample Sale
description: Save on notebooks, stationary, accessories, and more.

title: We Love a Theme: A Storytelling Show
description: A lineup of performers tell funny, heartwarming, and cringe-inducing tales at Bailey Swilley’s monthly storytelling show. Tonight’s ‘oooh that’s salty…’ theme features Stuart Ginsberg, Sarah Finucane, Anoush Froundjian, and Michele Carlo.

title: NYC Magic Ensemble
description: Expect the unexpected as the NYC Magic Ensemble presents a night of magicians and mentalists at Young Ethel’s, featuring performers Carl Mercurio, Eric Qiu, and Mike Kurylo.
cost: $10 (a limited number of 2-for-$15 tickets are also available)

title: Something Old, Something New, Something Blue: Pride Edition
description: Good things come in threes at the Something Old, Something New, Something Blue stand-up show, where comedians are required to include an old joke, a new joke, and a dirty joke in their sets. Hosted by Caitlin Reese (HBO), featuring Ely Kreimendahl, Danny Suggs, Calvin Cato, Jess Salomon, Jilberto Soto, and Micah Eames.

title: Scientific Controversies: Listening to Whales
description: Explore the scientific, philosophical, and technical challenges of communicating with whales, and consider what their language might reveal about intelligence, consciousness, and social bonds among other animals at tonight’s edition of Pioneer Works’ Scientific Controversies series.

title: Pages + Pours: A Book Swap with a Twist
description: Sip, swap, and socialize. Hear excerpts, reviews, and recommended pairings of recently loved literature from featured readers, then trade a book and dive into conversations with fellow book lovers.

title: Murder on Sex Island: A Book Release Show with Jo Firestone and Friends
description: Comedian Jo Firestone originally self-published Murder on Sex Island: A Luella Van Horn Mystery, and now it’s become a published-published book. To celebrate, Jo and friends will gather to play toxic reality show games, sign books, and do a Q&A.
cost: $10 admission (signed books will be available for purchase)

title: Naumburg Orchestral Concerts: 2025 Season
description: The Naumburg Orchestral Concerts series returns for its 120th season at historic Naumburg Bandshell in Central Park. Tonight: A Far Cry, a self-conducted chamber orchestra, performs works by Andrea Casarrubios, Shelley Washington, Richard Strauss, and more.

title: Live Band Karaoke at Arlene’s Grocery
description: Choose from a wide assortment of rock and pop songs and sing with your very own live band backing you up.
